questions.question: A system with input $x(t)$, gives the output signal $y(t) = x^2(t) + x(t^2)$. Which of the following properties does this system have?

explanations.Explanation: The system is neither linear not time-invariant.

questions.question: Find the magnitude of a 5-point moving average filter $H(\omega)$, where the output of the system is given by $y[n]=1/5 [x[n+2]+x[n+1]+x[n]+x[nâˆ’1]+x[n-2]]?

explanations.Explanation: For a moving average filter $h[n] = {1/5,1/5,1/5,1/5,1/5}$, $H(\omega) = e^j2\omega + e^j\omega + 1 + e^-j\omega + e^-2j\omega, H(\omega) = 1/5 (1+ 2\cos\omega + 2\cos2\omega) = 1/5 (1+ 2(\cos\omega + \cos2\omega))

questions.question: An impulse input signal generates two impulses at the output for an LTI system. If sum of two distinct impulses is given as input to this system, the output will contain

explanations.Explanation: The output will be sum of output of each impulse. Since there are two impulses in input, they can add up to contain either 3 or 4 impulses.

questions.question: When a moving average system of length $M$ is used for noise suppression,

answers.a: For large M, there is more suppression of noise
answers.b: For small M, there is more suppression of noise
answers.c: the system does not change the signal at all
